alert.note: Alert for Adams; Grant; Hettinger; Morton; Sioux; Stark (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 28 at 2:38PM CDT until April 29 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA SATURDAY AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY EVENING... .Critical fire weather conditions are possible across portions of southwest and south central North Dakota Saturday afternoon into Saturday evening. These areas may see relative humidities fall to around 18 percent, with sustained north northwest winds of around 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. These conditions could make controlling or suppressing any fires difficult. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA... The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon into Saturday evening. * WINDS...North northwest 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * AFFECTED AREA...Portions of southwest and south central North Dakota. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and become difficult to control or suppress.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
